dtliExcerpt: This backstage comedy about a strip club revue is so busy servicing its eccentric characters that it forgets to be funny.
bwwExcerpt: 'The Performers,' David West Read's romantic comedy about a lovers' showdown at an Adult Film Awards ceremony in Las Vegas, is dopey fun. That's not because the sensibility is raunchy, but because the sentiments are so corny. There's not much to cheer in the thin plot about married porn stars who teach a prudish couple a thing or two about true love and great sex; the big pleasure comes from watching true comic artists spin this trite material into gold.

wrongFullText:
Jul 11, 2008 4:08pm PT 

 

 
 
 

 

 
 J:Com pacts with MTV for series
 
 

 

 'SpongeBob,' 'Dora' to be available for free

TOKYO — J:Com, Japan’s biggest MSO, has partnered with MTV Networks Japan to offer four popular Nickelodeon shows on the J:Com TV Digital service free of charge.

The shows, “SpongeBob SquarePants,” “Dora the Explorer,” “The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius” and “Rugrats,” have been available on a VOD basis to 1.2 million J:Com TV Digital subs since July 1. Four episodes of each show air monthly.

In addition, “SpongeBob SquarePants” can be viewed by 5.5 million subs to the J:COM Channel every weekday from 2:30 p.m.-3 p.m.

All four shows can still be seen in Japan on the Nickelodeon strand, which broadcasts 24 hours a day in Japanese and English on the Sky PerfecTV! cable and satellite platform, as well as on cable TV and IPTV.
